Title: How Ethereum Founder Vitalik Buterin Keeps His Crypto Safe
URL Source: https://decrypt.co/228946/how-ethereum-founder-vitalik-buterin-keeps-crypto-safe
Published Time: 2024-05-01T14:38:51
Markdown Content: [Ethereum](https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-ethereum-quickly-explained-four-minute-guide) founder Vitalik Buterin is advising people to "decentralize your own security," after weighing in on a Twitter discussion about using cold wallets.
To prove his point, Buterin said that he keeps 90% of his crypto funds in a mutisig [Safe wallet](https://safe.global/).
"M-of-N, some keys held by you (but not enough to block recovery), the rest held by other people you trust," he wrote. "Don't reveal who those other people are, even to each other."
The "[m-of-n](https://blog.apnic.net/2021/05/28/what-is-m-of-n-in-public-private-key-signing/)" Buterin referred to describes one of the ways multisig, or multi-signature, wallets can be set up. The first variable refers to minimum number of signatures required to sign a contract, therefore spending or transferring funds from the wallet. The second variable refers to the total number of possible signatories that exist for the wallet.
The conversation started after a developer and research, who goes by the pseudonym [0xkofi](https://twitter.com/0xKofi/status/1785294613579730966) on Twitter, urged crypto traders to think about how devastating it would be to lose all their funds and avoid it by investing in cold storage.
> The above is why I use a multisig ([@safe](https://twitter.com/safe?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)) for >90% of my personal funds üôÇ > > M-of-N, some keys held by you (but not enough to block recovery), the rest held by other people you trust. Don't reveal who those other people are, even to each other. > > Decentralize your own security. > > ‚Äî vitalik.eth (@VitalikButerin) [May 1, 2024](https://twitter.com/VitalikButerin/status/1785562273433387320?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
"Your hardware wallet will be your fortress of solitude," Kofi wrote. "It will allow you to sleep peacefully at night. It will protect you so that you can survive this game long enough to win."
But not everyone is sold on that being the right way to protect their personal crypto stash. Peter Watts, Uneven Labs CEO and the founder of Reservoir, a developer platform for launching NFT collections, highlighted the risks involved in relying on hardware wallets.
[Vitalik Buterin Pushes for ‚ÄòPrivacy Pools‚Äô to Balance Anonymity With Regulatory Compliance](https://decrypt.co/155278/vitalik-buterin-pushes-for-privacy-pools-to-balance-anonymity-with-regulatory-compliance) ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin has co-authored a new research paper exploring how a privacy-preserving blockchain protocol could balance the need for user anonymity with regulatory compliance. The paper, co-authored by Buterin along with early Tornado Cash contributor Ameen Soleimani, Jacob Illum from the blockchain security firm Chainalysis, and two researchers from the University of Basel, delves into the subject of establishing a neutral infrastructure to incorporate privacy into blockch...
"When using a hardware wallet, the biggest risk becomes yourself," he wrote, adding that someone might find a stashed private seed phrase, or a user could secure it so well that they can't retrieve it themselves.
That's when Buterin chimed in to describe how he makes sure that he isn't the single point of failure for the security of his cold storage wallet.
Although Safe (formerly Gnosis Safe) multisig wallets have often been treated as a product to help DAOs and other groups manage shared treasuries, there's a lot of individuals who use them in a similar way to Buterin.
"Today, individuals make up more than 99% of Safe users, including notable ones like Vitalik Buterin and [P](https://decrypt.co/144816/nft-artwork-owned-three-arrows-capital-sells-6-2-million-sothebys)unk6529," wrote a SafeDAO contributor and delegate known as [Daniel](https://twitter.com/danftz) on Twitter.

Published Time: 2024-05-01T10:38:11.000-04:00
Markdown Content: One of the most interesting aspects of [blockchain](https://www.benzinga.com/money/what-is-blockchain/) is that everything is public. All transactions, wallets and portfolios are entirely accessible to anyone, allowing for an unprecedented amount of insight into a financial asset class.¬†
The uses of the data can range from monitoring overall trading activity and flows to seeing what the largest wallets and firms are doing with their positions. Arkham Intelligence is a blockchain analytics platform particularly interested in the second application. It cross-references financial disclosures by firms and individuals with on-chain activity to match up entities with specific wallet addresses.¬†
**Don't Miss:**
* **Dogecoin millionaires are increasing ‚Äî [**investors with $1M+ in DOGE revealed!**](https://www.benzinga.com/money/dogecoin-millionaires-adv)** * **According to Cathie Wood, holding 6 Ethereum (ETH) could make you a millionaire, [**here‚Äôs why it can be true**](https://www.benzinga.com/money/adv-6eth).**
With Arkham's insights, anyone can see how the largest entities in crypto are trading. One interesting application is looking at the largest firms in the space.
Coinbase, one of the largest crypto companies in the world, operates a centralized exchange, wallet service and a layer-2 called Base. [Coinbase's portfolio](https://platform.arkhamintelligence.com/explorer/entity/coinbase) is worth nearly $80 billion. The wallet is composed almost entirely of Ethereum (ETH) and Bitcoin (BTC). The firm holds over 900,000 BTC, currently worth over $55 billion. It also holds over 6.6 million ETH worth roughly $20 billion.¬†
While Coinbase operates as a crypto custodian, Grayscale is a crypto asset manager. It creates a handful of funds and ETFs that allow investors to access crypto products. In January, it was one of the first companies to offer a [spot Bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF)](https://www.benzinga.com/money/best-spot-bitcoin-etfs) converted from a previously released futures ETF. Grayscale's portfolio has more than 99% of its value in ETH and BTC. It owns 303,050 BTC worth $18.6 billion and 2.98 million ETH worth $9 billion. Grayscale holds $27.6 billion in crypto assets.¬†
**Trending: 1 in 4 Americans own a share of Bitcoin according to NASDAQ, [**how much would $10 get you today**](https://www.benzinga.com/money/kraken)?**
While it is mostly known for its equity platform, Robinhood began offering crypto several years ago. The crypto platform offers a handful of the most popular tokens, but the portfolio is mostly invested in ETH, BTC and Shiba Inu (SHIB). The wallet has 140,000 BTC worth $8.6 billion, 1.5 million ETH worth $4.7 billion and 42.5 trillion SHIB worth $1 billion.¬†
As the largest crypto exchange in the world, it is no surprise that Binance (BNB) has the largest portfolio, worth over $200 billion. It holds 165 million BNB worth $94 billion, 640,000 BTC worth $40 billion, $27.2 billion worth of Tether (USDT) and 4.4 million ETH worth $13.2 billion.¬†
Coinbase has the largest ETH holding on the list. Its $20 billion of ETH is more than 5% of the total supply. The four firms hold a combined 15.5 million ETH, which is roughly 12.7% of the supply.¬†
While this may make it seem like the supply of ETH is heavily concentrated among a few entities, Coinbase, Robinhood and Binance hold assets for their customers. The portion of the supply held by these firms is under the discretion of the millions of people who hold ETH on these brokerages.¬†

Published Time: 2024-05-01T10:33:17.000-04:00
Markdown Content: [Bitcoin spot Exchange-Traded Funds](https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/24/04/38518143/hong-kongs-bitcoin-etf-debut-records-0-2-of-first-day-us-etf-trading-volume) (ETFs) experienced a substantial outflow of funds, totaling $162 million on Tuesday, according to financial analytics firm SoSoValue.
**What Happened**: The **Grayscale Bitcoin Trust** GBTC alone saw a [withdrawal](https://sosovalue.xyz/assets/etf) of $93.2277 million, contributing significantly to its historical net outflow of $17.303 billion. **Fidelity‚Äôs** FBTC FBTC bled $35.28 million, while **Bitwise‚Äôs** BITB BITB saw an outflow of $34.31 million. **Ark‚Äôs ETF ARKB** ARKB was the only ETF recording a net inflow, albeit a modest $3.6 million.
Following these developments, the total net asset value of **Bitcoin** BTC/USD spot ETFs fell below the $50 billion mark, landing at $49.413 billion.
[![Image 1: a black background with a plane flying in the sky](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)](https://www.benzinga.com/events/digital-assets/)
_Also Read: [Patrick McHenry Questions SEC‚Äôs Transparency On Ethereum As A Security](https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/24/05/38548916/patrick-mchenry-questions-secs-transparency-on-ethereum-as-a-security)_
**Why It Matters**: This trend of outflows contrasts sharply with the optimism surrounding the launch of new cryptocurrency spot ETFs in Hong Kong.
Harvest Global Investments and other firms received approval from the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) to offer Bitcoin and Ethereum spot ETFs, which started trading on April 30, [according](https://wublock.substack.com/p/hong-kong-cryptocurrency-etf-first?r=jbpop&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=web&triedRedirect=true) to Wu Blockchain.
Notably, the initial offering of these ETFs saw significant interest from regions including Singapore and the Middle East, though Chinese mainland investors remain excluded from participating due to regulatory restrictions.
ChinaAMC led the launch with its Bitcoin and Ethereum spot ETFs, boasting an initial offering size that surpassed $125 million‚Äîoptimistically compared to U.S. launches by industry insiders.
However, the actual first-day trading volume in Hong Kong reached only $12 million, dwarfed by the $4.6 billion volume observed in the U.S. market on similar opening days.
This discrepancy underscores the varying investor appetite and market dynamics between the regions.
Despite the tepid trading volume, Hong Kong‚Äôs market showed signs of growth, with the listing of these ETFs heralded as a significant development in the region's financial landscape.
The SFC has outlined a comprehensive regulatory framework for these products, emphasizing the potential risks associated with high volatility and speculation in cryptocurrencies.
**What‚Äôs Next**: Looking ahead, the [Future of Digital Assets](https://www.benzinga.com/events/digital-assets/agenda/) event, scheduled by Benzinga on Nov. 19, is set to delve deeper into these developments.

Since the launch of Bitcoin in 2009, its value has risen dramatically, from less than 0.01 USD in May 2010 to over 67,000 USD in November 2021. Bitcoin is expected to attain newer feats in the coming years as more institutional investors and traders continue to turn to cryptocurrency. ### What Influences Bitcoin‚Äôs Price? The world‚Äôs premier cryptocurrency, Bitcoin, has recently taken a substantial hit, dipping below the $25.5K threshold and reaching its lowest value in three months. This downward trend follows a lawsuit initiated by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) against [Binance](https://www.cryptopolitan.com/news/binance-bnb/), a leading cryptocurrency exchange, and its founder and CEO, Changpeng Zhao (CZ). The news of this legal dispute sparked a swift wave of Bitcoin selling, causing a [ripple](https://www.cryptopolitan.com/news/ripple-xrp/) effect across the majority of other cryptocurrencies. The market strain has escalated as the SEC has expanded its legal pursuits to encompass Coinbase, another key contender in the cryptocurrency exchange market. Crypto experts posit that if Bitcoin can hold its resistance level at $26,000, we might see a bounce back in the coming months. However, if this level is breached, Bitcoin could potentially tumble to its lowest ever value of $20,000. Yet, the experts also caution that the current rise in interest rates and a more stringent monetary policy might hinder Bitcoin from making a significant recovery in the near term. Despite these hurdles, the year 2023 holds promise for Bitcoin advocates who see it as a ‚Äúdigital safe-haven‚Äù or ‚Äúvirtual gold‚Äù. These enthusiasts are confident that Bitcoin can offer investors a substantial hedge or attractive yields during periods of market instability. ### Bitcoin Challenges Despite its success, Bitcoin has faced several criticisms, especially its energy-hungry mining system. According to an energy consumption tracker developed by the University of Cambridge, Bitcoin mining was estimated to consume 100 TWh per year, about one-third of the UK‚Äôs total energy consumption in 2016. In addition, BTC‚Äôs criminality potential has positioned it for more scrutiny, as it has facilitated numerous dark web dealings, such as acquiring illegal weapons, money laundering, etc. The most significant and long-standing challenge of Bitcoin is scalability. Bitcoin‚Äôs underlying technology limits its performance in terms of transaction completion timeframe, with an insufficient capacity of 3-7 TPS. As more transactions are initiated on the network, processing delays will surface. Several proposals have been put forward to nip this concern in the bud, but a favorable long-term fix remains unclear. ### How do you buy and sell Bitcoin? You can buy and [sell Bitcoin](https://www.cryptopolitan.com/how-to-sell-bitcoin-everything-you-need/) through cryptocurrency exchanges or peer-to-peer platforms. To purchase Bitcoin, you typically need to create an account with a cryptocurrency exchange, fund your account, and place an order to buy Bitcoin. ### What is Bitcoin‚Äôs role in the broader financial system? Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are seen by some as a disruptive force that could challenge traditional financial systems and provide greater financial freedom and autonomy for users. ### Where to store Bitcoin? The best ways to store Bitcoin include hardware wallets, paper wallets, and software wallets. Hardware wallets are considered the most secure, as they store private keys offline and require physical confirmation of transactions. Paper wallets, which involve printing out private keys and keeping them in a secure location, are also considered secure but require careful handling. Software wallets, which run on computers or mobile devices, are a great option, but more vulnerable to hacking and malware attacks. ### What drives the value of BTC? Bitcoin‚Äôs value is determined by supply and demand factors, such as market sentiment, adoption rates, regulatory changes, and investor speculation. Bitcoin‚Äôs decentralized nature, scarcity, and high-security features also contribute to its value in the market. Conclusion ---------- Bitcoin has gained the mainstream adoption following massive interest from institutional giants. Some companies, like the Spanish firm Telefonica, now accept Bitcoin. Telefonica even works with a cryptocurrency exchange called Bit2Me to let people pay with Bitcoin. Looking ahead, Bitcoin seems to have a bright future with potential for its price to go up. Adding Bitcoin to your investment portfolio could be a good move, but it‚Äôs important to do your research and understand the risks before buying Bitcoin or any other cryptocurrency

[Blockchain](https://dailycoin.com/tag/blockchain/) forensics firm Elliptic said Wednesday it has made significant progress in using artificial intelligence (AI) to identify [Bitcoin](https://dailycoin.com/bitcoin-btc-birth-cryptocurrency-blockchain-revolution/) transactions made by illicit actors.

**New Bitcoin Money Laundering Pattern** ----------------------------------------

Of 52 ‚Äúmoney laundering‚Äù subgraphs predicted by the model and which ended up with deposits to an exchange involved in the research, 14 were confirmed to have been received by users who had already been flagged as being linked to possible money laundering.

Intermediary nested services include businesses that move funds through accounts at larger exchanges, often without the exchange‚Äôs awareness in the case of illicit activity.
‚ÄúNested services are known to frequently have less stringent customer due diligence checks than the cryptocurrency exchanges they utilize, or sometimes have no such anti-money laundering checks at all, resulting in their misuse for cryptocurrency laundering.‚Äù Elliptic described.

Title: Capitulation incoming? Bitcoin miners' revenue drops to a 6-month low

Published Time: 2024-05-01T15:13:01+00:00
Markdown Content: Bitcoin‚Äôs ([BTC](https://finbold.com/cryptocurrency/bitcoin/)) price shambled post-halving, with consecutive losses and the first [‚Äúred month‚Äù in April, after a 7-month green streak](https://finbold.com/bitcoin-price-red-alert-as-7-month-green-streak-ends-how-bad-is-it/). In this context, the Bitcoin miners‚Äô revenue in USD dropped to a 6-month low, slightly above $30 million.
Finbold retrieved [data](https://www.blockchain.com/explorer/charts/miners-revenue) from _Blockchain.com_ on May 1, showing $30.17 million of miners‚Äô revenue collected on April 30. Moreover, the 1-year chart illustrates this as the lowest revenue for Bitcoin miners in the past six months.
Notably, the most significant drop occurred after Bitcoin‚Äôs fourth halving, when the block subsidy reward changed from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC per mined block, drastically affecting the activity‚Äôs profitability.
### Picks for you
However, the situation worsened as the Bitcoin price in USD moved from around $70,000 to $57,000 month-over-month.
![Image 1: a graph showing the miners revenue](https://assets.finbold.com/uploads/2024/05/Bitcoin-miners-revenue-1024x576.jpg)
Bitcoin Miners Revenue, 1-year chart. Source: _Blockchain.com_
Bitcoin miners underwater, mining with losses as revenue drops --------------------------------------------------------------
As reported by Finbold on April 23, [Bitcoin miners are ‚Äúunderwater‚Äù with increased production costs](https://finbold.com/bitcoin-miners-underwater-as-production-costs-surge-post-halving/), mining BTC with losses. At that time, data from different sources estimated losses from $36,000 to $52,000 per [Bitcoin mined](https://finbold.com/guide/bitcoin-mining-guide/), with BTC trading at $66,000.
Again, this situation worsened amid the most recent [cryptocurrency market](https://finbold.com/category/cryptocurrency-news/) crash, which [liquidated long-position traders by $400 million](https://finbold.com/long-position-traders-lost-400-million-in-a-24-hour-bloodbath/). According to the previous sources, Bitcoin miners could be losing between $43,000 and $72,000 per BTC in this revenue drop.
In particular, _Capriole Investments_ has the most pessimistic production cost estimation of $128,989 per mined Bitcoin. The investment firm estimates that $77,400 is spent on electrical costs for each produced coin, considering [hashrate](https://finbold.com/guide/hashrate/#) averages.
![Image 2: a graph showing the production cost of bitcoin](https://assets.finbold.com/uploads/2024/05/Bitcoin-electrical-cost-capriole-1024x728.jpg)
Bitcoin Production Cost and Electrical Cost. Source: _Capriole Investments_
Meanwhile, [data](https://en.macromicro.me/charts/29435/bitcoin-production-total-cost) from _MacroMicro_ shows a less-worse cost/price ratio of 1.66, according to estimates from _Cambridge University_. As per this data, Bitcoin‚Äôs average mining cost was above $100,500 on April 30, close to historical highs in production costs, with miners theoretically losing around $43,000 for each BTC they issue.
![Image 3: a graph showing the price of bitcoin and ethereum](https://assets.finbold.com/uploads/2024/05/Bitcoin-average-mining-cost-macromicro-1-1024x343.jpg)
Bitcoin Average Mining Costs. Source: _MacroMicro_
Therefore, current data suggests potential industry turmoil that could cause some Bitcoin mining companies to capitulate. To prevent that, the Bitcoin price would need to rally above the estimated production costs, now at all-time highs.
If the production costs remain higher than the mining rewards, measured in U.S. dollars, the Bitcoin network could centralize in a few big miners. Experts have [warned](https://twitter.com/ColinLeMahieu/status/1778052049319412079) about that for years, mentioning the Economy of Scale dynamics inherent to Bitcoin, which threatens the system‚Äôs security.

* [![Image 1: Samuel Wan](https://dailycoin.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/Samuel-3-50x50.png)](https://dailycoin.com/author/samuel-wan/"SamuelWan")

* **After six months of waiting, a** **judge** **sentence****d** **CZ** **to** **imprisonment** **on April 30.** * **CZ** **expressed** **regret** **over his** **failures** **in running** **Binance****.**¬† * **The former** **Binance** **CEO** **intends to serve the** **sentence** **but looks forward to future** **projects****.**¬†
After a multi-year investigation, US authorities charged Binance and its co-founder Changpeng Zhao (CZ) with violating money laundering rules in November 2023. As part of the settlement, the company agreed to pay a $4.3 billion fine and exit the US market. The deal also involved CZ stepping down as company CEO, paying a $50 million fine, and pleading guilty to money laundering.
After months of legal limbo, Judge Richard Jones finally gave sentencing on April 30, ordering that CZ serve a four-month prison sentence. CZ responded by saying, ‚ÄúI will do my time,‚Äù and move forward after the ordeal is over.¬†
Looking to the Future ---------------------
Responding to the sentencing, CZ put on a brave face, stating that he intends to serve his sentence and put the matter behind him once it is done. Looking to the future, CZ stated that he will remain a passive crypto investor and plans to ‚Äúfocus on the next chapter of my life (education).‚Äù
> I would like to thank everyone for your care and support, be it writing letters, showing support on X, or in any other form. They all mean a lot to me and keep me strong. I will do my time, conclude this phase and focus on the next chapter of my life (education). > > I will remain a‚Ä¶ > > ‚Äî CZ üî∂ BNB (@cz\_binance) [May 1, 2024](https://twitter.com/cz_binance/status/1785465555899822488?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
While awaiting sentencing in the US, CZ had already set in motion Giggle Academy, a [free basic education platform](https://dailycoin.com/ex-binance-chief-changpeng-zhao-teases-new-educational-project/) for young students. Notably, it will not feature any cryptocurrency-related content.
The former Binance CEO thanked those who supported him during this ordeal. He stated that the messages of support and backing kept him strong through this uncertain period of his life.
Despite the prison sentence, many in the crypto industry consider CZ a victim of the ‚Äú[war on crypto](https://dailycoin.com/sec-chair-gensler-defends-crypto-crackdown/)‚Äù by US authorities. His guilty plea to money laundering violations enabled Binance to avoid further enforcement actions.
However, in delivering the sentence, Judge Jones clarified that CZ is responsible for Binance‚Äôs compliance failings.
CZ Expresses Regret¬† --------------------
In handing down sentencing, [Judge Jones stated](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/04/30/binance-founder-changpeng-zhao-cz-sentenced-to-four-months-in-prison-.html) that CZ had the ‚Äúwherewithal, finance capabilities, and people power‚Äù to ensure Binance complied with money laundering regulations. However, the judge determined that CZ ‚Äúfailed at that opportunity.‚Äù
While prosecutors had pushed for a [three-year prison term](https://dailycoin.com/u-s-doj-asks-changpeng-zhao-cz-to-be-jailed-for-3-years/), Judge Jones opted to show a degree of leniency by handing down a four-month sentence instead. The relatively light punishment suggested the court recognized CZ‚Äôs conduct in trying to resolve the case as quickly as possible.
Addressing the court, CZ stated that the sentence represents ‚Äúthe first step of taking responsibility.‚Äù He admitted his failure to ‚Äúimplement an adequate anti-money laundering program‚Äù at Binance, stating, ‚ÄúI realize now the seriousness of that mistake.‚Äù
On the Flipside ---------------
* **The average** **prison sentence** **for** **money laundering** **is** [**70 months**](https://www.ussc.gov/sites/default/files/pdf/research-and-publications/quick-facts/Money_Laundering_FY19.pdf)**, according to the** **US Sentencing Commission****.** * **Since the enforcement action,** **Binance****‚Äòs global** **market share** **has** [**dropped to 55%**](https://www.binance.com/en/square/post/7165350385162)**.**
Why This Matters ----------------
As much as the crypto industry paints a picture of decentralization and operating independently of legacy systems, CZ‚Äôs sentencing is evidence that authorities can pull anyone back into their jurisdiction if they choose.

Title: Elliptic's AI-driven research helps fight Bitcoin money laundering
URL Source: https://cryptobriefing.com/elliptic-ai-crypto-crime-detection/
Published Time: 2024-05-01T15:17:24+00:00
Markdown Content: Deep learning model identifies new money laundering behaviors to enhance Elliptic's crypto transaction monitoring -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Blockchain analytics firm Elliptic has made significant progress in using artificial intelligence (AI) to identify potential money laundering patterns on the Bitcoin blockchain.
In a [research paper](https://www.elliptic.co/blog/our-new-research-enhancing-blockchain-analytics-through-ai) co-authored with the MIT-IBM Watson AI Lab, Elliptic described its use of a deep learning model trained on a dataset of nearly 200 million transactions to detect illicit activity involving groups of bitcoin nodes and transaction chains.
The research builds upon a previous study conducted in 2019, which utilized a much smaller dataset of 200,000 transactions. The new ‚ÄúElliptic2‚Äù dataset contains 122,000 labeled ‚Äúsubgraphs,‚Äù representing groups of connected nodes and transaction chains known to have links to illicit activity. By training the AI model on this extensive dataset, [Elliptic](https://cryptobriefing.com/elliptic-estimates-12b-lost-to-defi-exploits/) aims to improve the accuracy and efficiency of detecting [money laundering](https://cryptobriefing.com/usdt-usage-money-laundering-surges-east-southeast-asia-un-report/) and other financial crimes on the blockchain.
[![Image 1: Sapphire](https://static.cryptobriefing.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/18060845/600x500.jpg)](https://sapphire.cryptobriefing.com/?utm_source=cryptobriefing&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=180324&ap=mreciad&offer=x240415070T0U7V)
The inherent transparency of blockchain data makes it well-suited for machine learning techniques, as transaction information and entity types can be readily analyzed. This stands in contrast to traditional finance, where transaction data is often siloed, making the application of [AI](https://cryptobriefing.com/ai/) more challenging.
The trained model successfully identified proceeds of crime deposited at a crypto exchange, as well as novel money laundering transaction patterns and previously-unknown illicit wallets. These findings are already being incorporated into Elliptic‚Äôs products to enhance their capabilities.
> ‚ÄúThe money laundering techniques identified by the model have been identified because they are prevalent in bitcoin,‚Äù Elliptic co-founder Tom Robinson explained in an email. ‚ÄúCrypto laundering practices will evolve over time as they cease being effective, but an advantage of an AI/deep learning approach is that new money laundering patterns are identified automatically as they emerge.‚Äù
The research revealed common money laundering techniques, such as ‚Äúpeeling chains,‚Äù where a user sends cryptocurrency to a destination address while sending the remainder to another address under their control, forming a chain of transactions. Another prevalent method involved the use of ‚Äúnested services,‚Äù businesses that move funds through accounts at larger crypto exchanges, sometimes even without the exchange‚Äôs knowledge or approval.
To encourage further collaboration and advancement in this field, Elliptic has made the ‚ÄúElliptic2‚Äù dataset publicly available. As the largest public dataset of its kind, it will enable the wider community to develop new AI techniques for detecting illicit cryptocurrency transactions and contribute to the ongoing fight against financial crime in the crypto space.

* **The SEC and Ripple Labs have clashed over the validity of an accountant‚Äôs testimony in their ongoing lawsuit.** * **The SEC has defended her role of summarizing financial data, which is a permissible practice within legal boundaries.** * **The dispute has hinged on whether the accountant stuck to basic calculations or delved into expert analysis.**
The [ongoing legal battle](https://dailycoin.com/sec-vs-ripple-will-lawsuit-decide-fate-crypto-industry/) between the [SEC](https://dailycoin.com/sec-and-crypto-us-regulator-influence-on-cryptocurrency/) and [Ripple Labs](https://dailycoin.com/ripple-xrp-xrp-industry-leader-or-cryptocurrency-dinosaur/) took a new turn as the SEC responded to Ripple‚Äôs challenge regarding the testimony of SEC accountant Andrea Fox. Ripple had sought to dismiss Fox‚Äôs declaration, arguing it constituted undisclosed expert testimony.¬†
Ripple and SEC Clash Over Expert Witness Status -----------------------------------------------
The SEC [strongly disagrees](https://twitter.com/FilanLaw/status/1785026413357105401), defending her work as a permissible form of summary evidence under established legal rules. The crux of the dispute lies in the nature of Fox‚Äôs contribution. Ripple contends that her role went beyond mere summarization, involving financial analysis and critical decisions about categorizing Ripple‚Äôs financial data.¬†
This, [according to Ripple](https://twitter.com/FilanLaw/status/1782578348423573898), necessitates disclosure as expert testimony. The SEC counters this claim, maintaining that Fox‚Äôs calculations are straightforward and lack the elements of expert analysis. They argue that her work involved no specialized skills or subjective opinions, simply basic calculations derived from Ripple‚Äôs financial records.
In their defense, the SEC emphasizes that Fox‚Äôs role was to simplify large volumes of financial data for the court‚Äôs benefit. They assert that using assumptions while handling such data is standard practice for summary witnesses and doesn‚Äôt elevate the evidence to the level of expert analysis.
The SEC further bolsters its argument by citing legal precedents that establish summary witnesses‚Äô acceptable use of assumptions in court proceedings. They maintain that Fox‚Äôs work falls squarely within the established parameters of a summary witness as outlined by relevant legal procedures, which clearly define expert witnesses as those providing specialized knowledge.
Narrow Focus Raises Concerns About Industry Regulation ------------------------------------------------------
While the SEC aims to uphold the legitimacy of Fox‚Äôs contribution, the case has drawn criticism for its seemingly narrow focus. Some argue that the SEC prioritizes investor protection against missed profit opportunities over addressing broader systemic issues within the cryptocurrency landscape, as highlighted by the recent [FTX collapse](https://dailycoin.com/sam-bankman-fried-cryptos-fallen-hero/).¬†
This incident has reignited concerns about the SEC‚Äôs effectiveness in regulating the rapidly evolving cryptocurrency market. The outcome of this legal battle will likely have significant implications for the future of cryptocurrency regulation and the SEC‚Äôs approach to navigating the complexities of this dynamic industry.
On the Flipside ---------------
* **The SEC argues that Andrea Fox‚Äôs work simply summarized financial data and lacked the complexity of expert analysis.** * **They maintain Fox‚Äôs role falls within the legal definition of a summary witness, distinct from experts providing specialized knowledge.**
Why This Matters ----------------
This legal battle between the SEC and Ripple hinges on the definition of ‚Äúexpert testimony‚Äù within cryptocurrency regulation. The outcome will set a precedent for how the SEC evaluates evidence in future crypto-related cases, potentially impacting the regulatory landscape for the entire industry.

Title: Bitcoin's Price Swings:¬† Here is Why BTC Market is Highly Volatile

Last Updated: May 1, 2024
* **Bitcoin‚Äôs volatility stems from its young existence, scarcity factor, and influence of large-scale investors.** * **Liquidity issues in the cryptocurrency market exacerbate Bitcoin‚Äôs price swings.** * **Regulatory developments and the introduction of financial products may mitigate Bitcoin‚Äôs volatility in the future.**
[Bitcoin](https://coinedition.com/bitcoin-holds-steady-at-62k-can-bulls-push-past-72k-resistance/?utm_source=telegram_channel&utm_medium=referral) still astounds the financial area with its thrilling price alterations. From its early ages of few cents even per coin to today‚Äôs highs reaching more than $74,000, Bitcoin‚Äôs journey has been nothing short of remarkable.¬†
However, this journey has been marked by extreme volatility, with fluctuations of over 80% in value at times. Uncovering the origin of Bitcoin‚Äôs volatile nature is crucial for the success of investors and analysts as well, because that can give an indication of the future of cryptocurrencies.
The Bitcoin volatility is rooted in a diverse range of factors which take beginnings in the characteristic of the digital currency that is very young. Unlike the aged traditional assets that have a centuries-long historical data, Bitcoin and the broader cryptocurrency market are unable to maintain stability that comes from decades of influence of established market dynamics.
This first stage of the cryptocurrency development model leads to the permanent process of price discovery, when the value of Bitcoin is regularly reassessed by the market, which results in great price fluctuations in reaction on new information and happenings.
One of the fundamental contributors to Bitcoin‚Äôs volatility is its [fixed](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/23311975.2021.1984624) supply cap of 21 million coins. This inherent scarcity factor can magnify price fluctuations as demand fluctuates against the unyielding supply limit. Additionally, the influence of large-scale investors, commonly referred to as ‚Äúwhales,‚Äù further exacerbates price volatility. Their substantial holdings allow them to sway market dynamics with significant buy or sell orders, leading to abrupt price changes.
Furthermore, the immaturity of the [cryptocurrency market](https://coinedition.com/market/) infrastructure introduces liquidity issues, wherein the capacity to execute large trades without impacting market prices is limited compared to more established markets. This lack of liquidity can intensify price swings as investors maneuver in and out of positions.
With the development of the cryptocurrency environment and regulatory frameworks taking shape, things might be changing for Bitcoin, which may moderate its volatility overtime. The emergence of Bitcoin-related derivatives shown in [spot ETFs](https://coinedition.com/bitcoin-etfs-promising-opportunities-and-potential-pitfalls-for-investors/) and the evolution of market infrastructure could make the trading process more stable.

Title: Redstone Network Launches to Power Fully On-Chain Ethereum Games
URL Source: https://decrypt.co/229005/redstone-network-launches-fully-on-chain-ethereum-games
Published Time: 2024-05-01T16:01:05
Markdown Content: [Redstone](https://redstone.xyz/), a new [Ethereum](https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-ethereum-quickly-explained-four-minute-guide) scaling network designed for fully on-chain games and ‚Äúautonomous worlds,‚Äù launched its mainnet today‚Äîwith a number of early games already available for play.
Developed by Ethereum startup [Lattice](https://lattice.xyz/), Redstone was built via [Optimism](https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-optimism-using-rollups-to-help-scale-ethereum)‚Äôs OP Stack scaling tech. But it‚Äôs much more than a rebranded riff on the layer-2 tech that also powers networks like [Base](https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-base-coinbases-layer-2-chain) and [Zora](https://decrypt.co/145650/zora-launches-layer-2-nft-netowrk-battle-ethereum-gas-fees)‚ÄîRedstone has been significantly retooled for the needs and demands of video games, particularly those that use blockchain for much more than asset ownership.
‚ÄúWe've had core developers come along and make really cool contributions to the OP Stack,‚Äù Optimism co-founder Ben Jones told _Decrypt_‚Äôs GG. ‚ÄúThis is the first \[network\] that‚Äôs not just tweaking dials a little bit.‚Äù Many crypto or ‚ÄúWeb3‚Äù games utilize technologies like NFTs for unique user-owned items or cryptocurrencies for decentralized economies. But fully on-chain or autonomous games also put their game logic or rules on-chain, working within the capabilities but also limitations of the decentralized technology to power playable games. ‚ÄúMost of the time, when you fully embrace the medium or the system you're building to, you tend to get more interesting results‚Äîand sometimes better harmonization‚Äîjust purely from a product development perspective,‚Äù Lattice co-founder and CEO Justin Glibert told _Decrypt_‚Äôs GG. Glibert says his team has embraced this model of building entirely on Ethereum, a ‚Äúcomputer that had to be multiplayer out of necessity, and not out of choice.‚Äù Following early experimental games like [Dark Forest](https://www.designboom.com/technology/dark-forest-one-of-a-kind-sci-fi-blockchain-game-cutting-edge-cryptography-brian-gu-gubsheep-11-15-2022/), zkDungeon, and OPCraft that his team created or helped build on other chains, they‚Äôve designed Redstone to better suit such games‚Äîand it‚Äôs open to the public.
Certainly, crypto games can be built on layer-1 networks, as well as general-purpose layer-2 scaling networks. But fully on-chain games can be held back by the way those networks are typically designed. Games need low latency speeds, for example‚Äîand with such a constant flow of player inputs, they need to cut down on the friction of interacting with a blockchain.
Redstone is built for just that, and it also features the first implementation of Plasma Mode, an alternative data availability protocol co-developed by Lattice and OP Labs. Plasma Mode allows for increased transaction throughput via an [off-chain data availability provider](https://specs.optimism.io/experimental/plasma.html), but also includes a permissionless Ethereum layer-1 feature that lets any user challenge suspicious inputs.
In short, Plasma Mode picks different kinds of design trade-offs to power games and other high-throughput decentralized apps, but also includes an on-chain capability to challenge potential threats. It‚Äôs inspired by the [Plasma concept](https://plasma.io/plasma-deprecated.pdf) that Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin co-authored back in 2017 (and recently [shined a fresh light on](https://vitalik.eth.limo/general/2023/11/14/neoplasma.html)), and will be available throughout the OP Stack going forward.
That‚Äôs paired with MUD, Lattice‚Äôs engine for on-chain Ethereum games. It‚Äôs being used by the studio‚Äôs own Sky Strife, a tactical strategy game in the vein of Nintendo‚Äôs classic Advance Wars that‚Äôs available to play today. Other Redstone launch games also use MUD, plus EVE Online developer CCP Games is using the engine for its [Project Awakening game](https://decrypt.co/221814/project-awakening-preview-eve-online-crypto-game)‚Äîthough Glibert said that CCP has yet to choose a network for that project.
Along with Sky Strife, the [initial lineup of Redstone games](https://community.redstone.xyz/) includes titles like [Biomes](https://twitter.com/biomesAW), a Minecraft-like sandbox game; [DF Ares](https://twitter.com/DFArchon), a community-driven revival of Dark Forest; and [Downstream](https://twitter.com/DownstreamGame), which has been described both as an ‚Äúinfinitely moddable MMO‚Äù and the ‚Äúworld's first post-singularity civilization simulator.‚Äù
![Image 1: A screenshot from Sky Strife](https://img.decrypt.co/insecure/rs:fit:3840:0:0:0/plain/https://cdn.decrypt.co/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/sky-strife.jpeg@webp)
A screenshot from Sky Strife. Image: Lattice
One of the more distinctive games on the launch list is [DEAR](https://twitter.com/dear_dyr), a game by ARPA that sounds like a cross between an abstract art project, a virtual pet simulator, and a crypto-fied social experiment. Or as an ARPA representative described it, ‚ÄúDEAR is a digital creature that transforms under the collective behavior of all players‚Äîa tug of war between two factions, whether you feed or abuse the creature.‚Äù
‚ÄúExperimental‚Äù is a fair term to describe most of what‚Äôs happening around Redstone and fully on-chain games. Some of the early games look far from mass-market in aesthetic and are built around new and unfamiliar concepts.
There are various benefits to being fully on-chain, Glibert said, such as the ability to easily deploy modifications to games and create new business models around existing games. Fully on-chain games (FOCGs) can‚Äôt be shut down or erased from existence like some Web2 games, while autonomous worlds (AWs) could yield new kinds of play mechanics and experiences.
> This onchain game introduces an interplay of LOVE and HATE, with a PVP twist. > > DEAR gamer, > > DEAR is a creature that inhabits a dark, digital forest, with cellular components woven into smart contracts. DEAR exhibits purposeful behaviour and mimics essential human interactions,‚Ä¶ [pic.twitter.com/gRw2c5ucHc](https://t.co/gRw2c5ucHc) > > ‚Äî ggQuest (@gg\_quest\_gg) [April 24, 2024](https://twitter.com/gg_quest_gg/status/1783181178645725469?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
Whether there‚Äôs a business here, however, remains to be seen.
‚ÄúMost of the studios out there that have raised capital to build on-chain games‚Äînobody knows if it's actually going to be a valuable market,‚Äù said Glibert. ‚ÄúI would say most of the people that are doing this seriously, they also don't know if there's actually a mature-enough business model today to do it.‚Äù
But they‚Äôre still building, attempting to push the edges of what‚Äôs possible on-chain.
‚ÄúThere is a lot of noise of ‚Äòhow to monetize‚Äô before a FOCG actually takes shape,‚Äù ARPA co-founder and CTO Majorknight told _Decrypt_‚Äôs GG. ‚ÄúRushed monetization is the [killer of innovation](https://andrewkelley.me/post/why-we-cant-have-nice-software.html). At best, it creates one-hit-wonders like the [play-to-earn](https://decrypt.co/resources/what-are-play-to-earn-games-how-players-are-making-a-living-with-nfts) games we have seen and doesn't have anything to do with making FOCGs, or improving the infrastructure.‚Äù
Majorknight described the Lattice team as a team of ‚Äúyoung, talented, and driven people who focus on building the infrastructure‚Äù for such games, further praising them for attempting to empower new types of on-chain games.
‚ÄúThe original vision of FOCGs is to utilize risk-free and creative scenarios to test the possibility of new blockchain applications and push the boundary of the infrastructure, similar to the relationship between games and simulations in science/engineering and between games and GPUs,‚Äù they added. ‚ÄúWho else to collaborate with if not the team who coined the term FOCG/AWs and established this vision beyond the short-sighted monetization?‚Äù
_Edited by [Stephen Graves](https://decrypt.co/author/stephengraves)_

Title: Bitcoin Greed No More: Sentiment Back At Neutral After $57,000 Plunge
URL Source: https://www.newsbtc.com/bitcoin-news/bitcoin-greed-sentiment-neutral-57000-plunge/
Published Time: 2024-05-01T16:00:56Z
Markdown Content: Data shows that Bitcoin sentiment has cooled off to neutral from greed following the asset‚Äôs latest plunge to the $57,000 level.
Bitcoin Fear & Greed Index Has Returned To Neutral Levels ---------------------------------------------------------
The ‚Äú[Fear & Greed Index](https://www.newsbtc.com/crypto/why-crypto-fear-greed-index-sustainable-recovery/)‚Äù is an indicator created by [Alternative](https://alternative.me/crypto/fear-and-greed-index/) that shows the average sentiment among investors in the Bitcoin and wider cryptocurrency market.
This index estimates sentiment by considering five factors: volatility, trading volume, social media data, market cap dominance, and Google Trends.
![Image 1](https://servedbyadbutler.com/error/blank.gif)
[![Image 2: a gold and black poker chip with the words huge get bonus](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4118444)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2374568&setID=366606&channelID=0&CID=873125&banID=521839794&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2293217&adSize=728x90&mt=1714581695959086&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbtc.com%2Fbitcoin-news%2Fbitcoin-greed-sentiment-neutral-57000-plunge%2F&hc=e82f54966e1de3211b3861befd9e926613b51c4b&location=)
The metric uses a scale that runs from zero to 100 to represent this average sentiment. All values under 46 suggest that investors are fearful, while those above 54 imply a greedy market. The zone between these two cutoffs naturally corresponds to the territory of neutral mentality.
Now, here is what the Bitcoin sentiment looks like right now, according to the Fear & Greed Index:
![Image 3: Bitcoin Fear & Greed Index](https://www.newsbtc.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/meter.png?w=367&resize=367%2C332)
[![Image 4: a gold and black poker chip with the words huge get bonus](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4118444)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2374569&setID=452518&channelID=0&CID=873125&banID=521839794&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2293218&adSize=728x90&mt=1714581695958963&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbtc.com%2Fbitcoin-news%2Fbitcoin-greed-sentiment-neutral-57000-plunge%2F&hc=4eacfdee76c3219845682d6bcb482aa3c92a0371&location=)
The value of the metric appears to be 54 at the moment | Source: [Alternative](https://alternative.me/crypto/fear-and-greed-index/)
As displayed above, the Bitcoin Fear & Greed Index is at a value of 54, implying that investors share a neutral sentiment currently. However, the neutrality is only just, as the metric is right at the boundary of the greed region.
This is a significant departure from yesterday‚Äôs sentiment: 67. The chart below shows how the indicator‚Äôs value has changed recently.
![Image 5: Bitcoin Neutral](https://www.newsbtc.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/chart.png?w=860&resize=860%2C408)
[![Image 6: a gold and black poker chip with the words huge get bonus](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=4118444)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=2374570&setID=452519&channelID=0&CID=873125&banID=521839794&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=2293220&adSize=728x90&mt=1714581696135905&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbtc.com%2Fbitcoin-news%2Fbitcoin-greed-sentiment-neutral-57000-plunge%2F&hc=268a890d886706066f2a7c7bb03ddd2dd6dc8db8&location=)
The trend in the Fear & Greed Index over the past year | Source: [Alternative](https://alternative.me/crypto/fear-and-greed-index/)
As the graph shows, the Bitcoin Fear & Greed Index has been declining recently. For most of February and March, as well as the first half of April, the indicator was in or near a special zone called [extreme greed](https://www.newsbtc.com/bitcoin-news/bitcoin-traders-no-extremely-greedy-rebound-signal/).
The market assumes this sentiment at values above 75. As the asset price struggled recently, the mentality cooled off from this extreme zone and entered the normal greed region. With the latest crash in BTC, the index has seen a sharp plunge, now exiting out of greed altogether.
Historically, cryptocurrency has tended to move against the majority‚Äôs expectations. The stronger this expectation, the higher the probability of such a contrary move.
This expectation is considered the strongest in extreme sentiment zones, as well as extreme fear and greed. As such, major bottoms and tops have often occurred in these territories.
The [all-time high (ATH) price](https://www.newsbtc.com/news/bitcoin-blasts-past-70000-in-wild-week-to-register-new-all-time-high/) last month, which continues to be the top of the rally so far, also occurred alongside extreme values of the Bitcoin Fear & Greed Index.
With the sentiment now cooled to neutral, some investors may be watching for a fall into fear. This is natural because a rebound would become more probable the worse the sentiment gets now.
BTC Price ---------
During Bitcoin‚Äôs latest plunge, its price briefly slipped below $57,000 before surging back to $57,300.

The crypto community is witnessing a virtual showdown between Cardano Founder, [Charles Hoskinson](https://bitcoinist.com/cardano-leadership-shakeup-charles-hoskinson/) and Ripple‚Äôs Chief Technology Officer (CTO), [David Schwartz](https://bitcoinist.com/one-project-man-ripple-cto-clarifies-where-his-loyalty-lays/). The two crypto giants are clashing over Ripple‚Äôs present regulatory challenges and the allegations surrounding the [ETH Gate](https://bitcoinist.com/ethereum-watchdog-sues-sec-over-eth-gate/).¬†¬†
Hoskinson And Schwartz Embark On Heated Debate ----------------------------------------------
Tensions have flared up within the crypto community as Hoskinson and Schwartz engaged in a [fiery debate](https://www.newsbtc.com/news/eth-gate-conversation-intensifies-after-ripple-cto-and-cardano-founder-debate/) over allegations of conspiracy within the Ethereum community and [Ripple‚Äôs ongoing legal battle](https://bitcoinist.com/xrp-lawsuit-sec-counters-ripple-motion-to-strike/) with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).¬†
[![Image 2: a banner with the words'bitstarz' and an image of a woman in a red dress](https://servedbyadbutler.com/getad.img/;libID=844202)](https://servedbyadbutler.com/redirect.spark?MID=172179&plid=1983102&setID=367529&channelID=0&CID=727083&banID=520891527&PID=0&textadID=0&tc=1&scheduleID=1911064&adSize=728x90&mt=1714581720646747&sw=800&sh=600&spr=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fbitcoinist.com%2Fcardano-founder-ripple-ethgate%2F&hc=c15aa05814ce05cc0cdbf456a4f5f56bbbd57739&location=)
The controversy had begun when Hoskinson had publicly addressed rumors which claimed that the [Ethereum community had influenced the regulatory decisions](https://bitcoinist.com/ethereum-insider-ripple-lawsuit-part-bigger-plan/) of the Ripple case by allegedly bribing the SEC to go after XRP. The Cardano founder had vehemently dismissed these allegations as unfounded conspiracy theories lacking credible evidence.¬†
In a swift rebuttal, Schwartz [raised questions](https://x.com/joelkatz/status/1784680727742963831?s=46) about a potential conflict of interest involving [William Hinman](https://bitcoinist.com/xrp-army-clues-hinman-ethereum-free-pass-ripple/), the former director of the US SEC. He clarified that he had never taken a stance on the rumors and arguments related to the ETH Gate, rather his statements have consistently revolved around the belief that someone within the [Ethereum community had bribed the SEC to target XRP.](https://www.newsbtc.com/news/ethereum/cardano-founder-ethgate-ethereum/)¬†
Responding to Hoskinson‚Äôs comment, an XRP supporter and crypto member [accused](https://x.com/quadjacksxrp/status/1784685849776468169?s=46) the Cardano founder of constantly using a preface in his posts to elicit sympathy rather than directly addressing the main problem. The member had also suggested that Hoskinson often portrays himself as a victim within the crypto community while refusing to change his opinions.

The XRP supporter criticized the Cardano founder for aggravating the issues by insulting the XRP community and Schwartz, while simultaneously adopting a ‚Äúnarcissistic victim‚Äù stance.¬†
Hoskinson defended his position, [asserting](https://x.com/iohk_charles/status/1784433766615646407?s=46) that he did not misspeak, and solidified his belief that allegations involving the Ethereum community bribing the SEC were and ‚Äúhas always been a conspiracy theory.‚Äù¬†

Title: DeFi lender Pike Finance loses $1.9M to two hacks in less than a week
URL Source: https://protos.com/defi-lender-pike-finance-loses-1-9m-to-two-hacks-in-less-than-a-week/
Published Time: 2024-05-01T15:47:57+00:00
Markdown Content: Pike Finance has been hacked for the second time in four days, with losses across the two incidents totaling approximately $1.9 million.
In response to the first hack, on April 26, the team immediately paused the protocol. However, this opened up a new vulnerability that was exploited between 21:45 and 22:20 (UTC) on April 30.
Crypto security firm Ancilia quickly [identified](https://twitter.com/AnciliaInc/status/1785440926212751446) three malicious transactions on the [Optimism](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/tx/0x6baa6332f9a3ed75e727311d6317fb636844d61d9df5e199f9f68711eb632d6f), [Arbitrum](https://arbiscan.io/tx/0xdac6af5695ba00b3d229574dbf7fcc326d16b9f8a52ad2620637d3022956d157), and [Ethereum](https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe2912b8bf34d561983f2ae95f34e33ecc7792a2905a3e317fcc98052bce66431) networks. Ancilia [states](https://twitter.com/AnciliaInc/status/1785452418945429981) the attacker was able to ‚Äòupgrade‚Äô and take control of the Pike Finance contracts, which allowed them to withdraw the funds held within.
The stolen assets were **swapped to ETH** and [consolidated](https://etherscan.io/address/0x19066f7431df29a0910d287c8822936bb7d89e23#internaltx) in the attacker‚Äôs Ethereum [address](https://etherscan.io/address/0x19066f7431df29a0910d287c8822936bb7d89e23) before being [deposited](https://etherscan.io/tx/0xf8ce549fe83ecaf0d889ef5bda0b613081cefdad5bd82237e3a9014584a95d11) into privacy protocol Railgun.
Read more: [Hackers switching to centralized exchanges to fund crypto attacks](https://protos.com/hackers-switching-to-centralized-exchanges-to-fund-crypto-attacks/)
The hack was [acknowledged](https://twitter.com/PikeFinance/status/1785572875124330644) by the Pike team on X (formerly Twitter). The post put the losses at approximately **64k OP ($150,000), 100k ARB ($105,000), and 480 ETH ($1.4 million)** and admitted that the hack was related to the previous incident.
The last time Pike Finance was [hacked](https://twitter.com/PikeFinance/status/1783989069212799321) (three days ago), it suffered losses of around $300,000 worth of the USDC stablecoin. The resulting funds were swapped for ETH and transferred to the crypto-mixing service Tornado Cash.
According to the earlier incident‚Äôs [post-mortem report](https://mirror.xyz/pikefinance.eth/M1ToE42vwEHuE6xlz0dVRQwPT0xpaRtpIIw2arOdBAM), the protocol was paused to prevent any further losses while the incident was investigated. The report also admits that the vulnerability had been reported by auditors OtterSec, but that the Pike team ‚Äúwas unable to address the identified vulnerability in a timely manner.‚Äù
However, as described in today‚Äôs [response](https://twitter.com/PikeFinance/status/1785572875124330644) to the second hack, pausing the contracts inadvertently introduced ‚Äúan additional dependency within the smart contract code.‚Äù This led to a ‚Äúmisalignment in storage mapping‚Äù which the attacker could take advantage of, reinitializing the contract and assuming full control.
Pike Finance has offered a **20% bounty for the return of the funds** and has promised to provide a ‚Äúplan to make users whole.‚Äù
The community‚Äôs opinions on this response can be seen in the Pike Finance Discord.
![Image 1: a black screen with emojis on it](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXdAnEfzBJwt7tS3R1W1vRjp3k9dv9Kbktlxwb1Jy8bTroqsiLcyW0kC7NTUKb9TLeFvQS3fjxTP7VL0zEGLhrsacFQLUCkM-_OhOoZgrL4iER7Z8QCoQ_5jEkdgCchxL2ckDYNK5nCjhUbV_dNGVDHjT2dB?key=UdeyZSePlEFr4v8PVZRAoQ)
_Read more: [Tornado Cash funds ‚Äòat risk‚Äô after hacker injects malicious code](https://protos.com/tornado-cash-funds-at-risk-after-hacker-injects-malicious-code/)_
After being hit twice in a row, users are understandably upset, and [some](https://twitter.com/deucesofweb3/status/1785576987550957856) have [suggested](https://twitter.com/Picolas_Caged/status/1785581065693778260) that Pike Finance refund pre-sale investments.
This in itself has, [predictably](https://twitter.com/PikeFinance/status/1785607580146163876), opened up another potential attack vector as scam replies (impersonating the Pike Finance account) promise a refund to victims as part of a common phishing technique.

Title: CBN's KYC audit sends shockwaves through Nigerian Fintech
URL Source: https://www.cryptopolitan.com/kyc-sends-shockwave-through-nigerian-fintech/
Markdown Content: Four well-known fintech companies have received orders from the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) to stop onboarding new clients. This mandate is part of a larger audit of OPay, Kuda Bank, Moniepoint, and PalmPay‚Äôs KYC procedures.
KYC concerns prompt temporary onboarding pause ----------------------------------------------
The CBN directive [influenced](https://techcabal.com/2024/04/29/exclusive-cbn-directs-four-fintechs-to-stop-onboarding/) the operation of these fintech platforms, ‚Äúthey have been put on hold for the time being, meaning those who would have had new accounts cannot continue.¬†
Each website features a notice of apology, indicating no disgrace on their account for the momentary interruption that affected them. Because no new customers are to be acquired, the continuing operation and the existing customers‚Äô deposits remain safe and sound.‚Äù
The move entails the Central Bank devising measures reflecting a series of events in which the legitimacy of the fintech platform was called into question due to loose KYC regulations.¬†
The story goes back to Fidelity Bank in October 2023, which had similar concerns about fraudulent activities restricting OPay, PalmPay, Kuda, and MonieP transactions. In turn, the banking authority implemented new KYC rules for any related financial institutions, and they focused on fintech startups as the most prominent threat.
Government crackdown on Fintech -------------------------------
Government involvement in the fintech industry is practically the CBN directive. The alignment of the National Security Agency (NSA) and economic-related fraud agencies like the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) in the battle against financial misdoings exposes their undeniable effort to eradicate such acts.¬†
The EFCC‚Äôs recent blocking of over a thousand accounts involved in unauthorized foreign exchange market transactions clearly shows the extra regulatory attention the financial sector is now subject to. The industry has mixed reactions, from cautious optimism to concerns about intensifying trade tensions.¬†
While some industries welcome the assistance afforded by higher domestic production requirements to strengthen their competitive edge, others fear that worldwide trade relations may become increasingly complicated.
Although stopping the enrollment of a new customer base may disrupt business operations, the independent decision by the regulators is the right move in that it guards against regulatory infringements as it safeguards the financial risks.¬†
The recently conducted audit of KYC procedures is undoubtedly evidence of the industry‚Äôs determination and commitment to ensuring regulatory oversight.
Regulatory evolution --------------------
However, amid these interventions, several positive policies and programs are currently being implemented within Nigeria‚Äôs financial regulatory structure.
The appointment of Emomotimi Agama as the new Director General of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) by the crypto community and investors not only for the recent economy but also for the future‚Äôs crypto economy is considered by cryptocurrency enthusiasts as an optimistic move.¬†
The appointment fosters devotion among investors, controls the capital market, and accelerates economic growth. The regulatory authority and fintech start-ups are expected to collaborate to expedite the process of acquiring licenses to operate crypto exchanges in Nigeria.¬†
Some stakeholders view the selection of Emomotimi Agama as a positive outcome that vows to open a new chapter of consensus between regulators and the crypto industry, which should result in an appropriate framework for innovation and growth.
The CBN‚Äôs resoluteness against the currently ongoing activities of e-currency firms, which has led to the central bank‚Äôs ban on their customer onboarding operations, further explains the necessity of the KYC process for the financial system.¬†Although they might be less desirable in the short run, such regulatory measures were intended to control standards of compliance and financial risks.

Title: An ETH ETF Wouldn‚Äôt Deliver Full-Returns to Investors
URL Source: https://www.coindesk.com/business/2024/05/01/an-eth-etf-wouldnt-deliver-full-returns-to-investors/
Published Time: 2024-05-01T16:00:00Z
Markdown Content: _ETFs bring awareness but are less effective than private funds as an ETH investment vehicle._
With the recent approval, launch and success of [spot bitcoin ETFs](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2024/04/19/bitcoin-spot-etfs-register-five-day-withdrawals-streak-ahead-of-halving/), all eyes have turned to the possibility of spot ETH ETF regulatory approval, an outcome we believe to be unlikely under the current administration. Additionally, an ETH ETF will, at least initially, lack a staking reward component, a key aspect of ETH total return.
We see the primary value of crypto-ETFs being the _normalization_ of crypto investing for traditional finance allocators. Large ETF providers entering the space license their legitimacy, allowing allocators to invest in crypto without taking career-risk. However, for all the industry benefits of a spot ETH ETF, the return characteristics are not as attractive as total return options.
At the time of writing, rewards from staking eth are over 3% per annum, according to [CESR, the benchmark composite ether staking rate](https://www.coindesk.com/indices/ether/cesr/). In other words, if an investor invests into an ETH ETF, they may be at a disadvantage compared to someone investing in a staked investment. CESR has been as high as 8% in the trailing twelve months.
**You're reading** [**Crypto Long & Short**](https://www.coindesk.com/newsletters/crypto-long-short/)**, our weekly newsletter featuring insights, news and analysis for the professional investor.** [**Sign up here**](https://www.coindesk.com/newsletters/crypto-long-short/) **to get it in your inbox every Wednesday.**
**ETH ETFs ‚Äî A liquidity mismatch due to staking**
Mechanically, staking reduces liquidity due to the validator entry and exit queues. In the summer of 2023 the entry queue rose to 45 days due to a surge in activity. As a network security activity, staking is not designed with the liquidity needed for securitization in mind. Due to the immense liquidity demands of an ETF, issuers will struggle to deliver liquidity and ETH total return, including staking rewards.
**Structural Underperformance**
Passively holding unstaked ETH is akin to holding unneeded fiat currency for long periods in a demand deposit account with zero interest. Said another way, passively holding unstaked ETH will create structural underperformance and, if compared to a total return benchmark, persistent negative tracking error. From any angle, that is an untenable position for an investor.
For accredited investors, private funds offer an effective solution to achieve total return ETH exposure. Buying and staking ETH through a private fund structure does not face regulatory challenges. Managers can also match the liquidity of the fund to stake and unstake ETH on behalf of investors. With a thoughtful operational setup, there are limited tradeoffs; a private fund can be audited, benchmarked, and keep assets in qualified custody.

Title: Eminem's new crypto ad fails to capture the moment, lets it slip
URL Source: https://blockworks.co/news/eminem-cryptocom-advertisement-silly
Markdown Content: ![Image 1: off topic with molly jane](https://blockworks-co.imgix.net/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/Off-Topic-with-Molly-Jane_20230616a-1.png?w=1024&h=1024)
This isn‚Äôt going to be another op-ed about how silly it is for celebrities to do cryptocurrency ads. We all know that they don‚Äôt age well.
Instead, what I‚Äôd like to opine on is why a cryptocurrency ad with Marshall Mathers, aka Eminem, falls flat in particular. If you‚Äôre going to put a celebrity in your crypto ad, you need to go all out with creativity, humor or just overall entertainment value. Eminem‚Äôs new crypto ad does none of that ‚Äî¬†it has almost nothing to do with the rapper, or crypto at all.
The rapper‚Äôs voiceover on an [advertisement for Crypto.com](http://crypto.com/) aired during the Lakers NBA play-off game last week. The ad itself, just a minute long, shows a nameless, faceless boxer getting ready to face-off in a match at the Crypto.com Arena. You can hear Eminem‚Äôs voice saying empty platitudes of encouragement in the background, telling the audience to enjoy the moment, before the screen shows the somewhat infamous slogan, ‚ÄúFortune favors the brave.‚Äù
I say infamous, because Matt Damon‚Äôs 2022 Crypto.com SuperBowl commercial ‚Äî¬†where the Oscar-nominated actor was actually pictured on screen saying that catchphrase out loud ‚Äî just looked so silly in the wake of the FTX crash. Damon later gave an [awkward, pause-filled red carpet interview](https://gizmodo.com/matt-damon-crypto-com-crypto-bitcoin-1850282413), noting that he only did the commercial to support his water non-profit in a down year.
Some are [already speculating](https://www.stereogum.com/2261473/eminem-is-crypto-coms-new-spokesman-teases-new-album-the-death-of-slim-shady/news/) that Eminem‚Äôs main motivation to lend his voice to Crypto.com‚Äôs latest ad is part of a marketing push for his upcoming album. But his motivations for being crypto‚Äôs latest celebrity spokesperson aren‚Äôt important. What‚Äôs important is how soulless that advertisement is. Watching the commercial for the first time as a longtime Eminem stan, I lamented all of the missed opportunities staring me in the face.
**Read more from our opinion section:** [Crypto‚Äôs best use case? Buying goats on Twitter](https://blockworks.co/news/cryptos-best-use-case-buying-goats-twitter)
For one, this is far from Eminem‚Äôs first foray into crypto ‚Äî¬†he had his own, pretty cringey Bored Ape phase at the peak of the NFT boom, culminating in a [half-animated BAYT music video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RjrA-slMoZ4) with none other than Snoop Dogg. That was terrible, and also funny: and Crypto.com‚Äôs pretty basic ad could have benefitted from any sort of creative reference to Eminem‚Äôs actual crypto interests.¬†
Granted, Crypto.com is not an NFT platform. That doesn‚Äôt mean that you aren‚Äôt allowed to have a sense of humor ‚Äî especially when creating a likely very expensive advertisement with a very famous, previously NFT-obsessed rapper.
Which brings me to my second point ‚Äî¬†there‚Äôs no rap. Paying Eminem to remain faceless and read a short, only slightly rhyming text over a black-and-white boxing video feels like paying [Bob Dylan to promote Victoria‚Äôs Secret](https://www.thecut.com/2019/07/i-think-about-bob-dylans-victorias-secret-ad-a-lot.html).
Eminem‚Äôs crypto ad isn‚Äôt the first since the unfortunate crypto Super Bowl. Both Coinbase and Greyscale also [put out slightly more entertaining ads](https://blockworks.co/news/nba-nhl-bitcoin-halving-ads) in the lead up to the Bitcoin halving, albeit celebrity-less ones.¬†
As I said at the top, my point here isn‚Äôt to convince the world that celebrities in crypto ads are setting themselves up for [future embarrassment](https://blockworks.co/news/celebrities-erase-ftx-ties), [loss of money](https://blockworks.co/news/what-do-tom-brady-steph-curry-and-naomi-osaka-have-in-common-an-ftx-lawsuit) and even potentially [SEC fines](https://www.sec.gov/news/press-release/2022-183). We already know that. And I also know that no one will stop crypto companies, especially during a bull market, from paying celebrities tons of money to promote their brands anyway. Sam Bankman-Fried set that precedent, and even with him in jail, it really shows no signs of abating.
Instead, I‚Äôd like to propose that if we are going to keep having celeb-studded crypto ads ‚Äî¬†make them really sparkle. Pay Eminem to write an entire song about trading on Crypto.com and release it alongside his new album, with a specially crypto-themed music video (he already has the experience). Get JoJo Siwa to [wrap another car](https://www.tiktok.com/@itsjojosiwa/video/7352686405887331630) with whatever memecoin logo, or Brooklyn Beckham to tattoo Dogecoin eyes next to his [tattoo of his wife‚Äôs eyes](https://pagesix.com/article/brooklyn-beckham-tattoos-for-nicola-peltz/).
Celebrity crypto ads, in my opinion, should only exist if they do something really creative or really silly: In other words, make them match the whimsy and creativity of this burgeoning financial tech industry. I‚Äôm not sure that any SEC lawyers would agree with me. Good thing I don‚Äôt work for the SEC.
Otherwise, make celebrity crypto endorsements illegal for all of the obvious reasons (high potential for securities fraud and misleading investors to start). In a nutshell ‚Äî¬†go silly or go home.
* * *
_I don‚Äôt care much about tech, I don‚Äôt care a whole lot about finance, either. I care about writing stories and watching weird things unfold. And that‚Äôs why I‚Äôve ended up in crypto._
_But because I‚Äôm missing that passion for what crypto and blockchain are all about ‚Äî finance, tech, privacy, yadda yadda ‚Äî I‚Äôm going to write instead about what I am actually interested in. Everything about crypto that has very little to do with crypto._
_That‚Äôs what this column will be about. All the tangential stories that come out of the blockchain and crypto space, what I think about them, and how I navigate it all as a skeptical former Russian literature major._
_It‚Äôs precisely my perch as an outsider that lets me do what I do: Opine on all sides of any crypto issue, no strings attached, no skin in the game._
_If you want to talk crypto with me, let‚Äôs go off topic._

Title: ETH Founder Vitalik Reveals 90% of His Crypto Held in Multi-Sig Service

Published Time: 2024-05-01T17:00:00+00:00
Markdown Content: Published: May 1, 2024
Last Updated: May 1, 2024
* **Vitalik Buterin uses a multi-sig wallet for 90% of his crypto to enhance security.** * **He recommended a multi-sig solution to minimize the personal risks of hardware wallets.**¬† * **In a multi-sig solution, users hold some keys but are insufficient to recover the funds independently.**
[Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin](https://coinedition.com/ethereum-founder-vitalik-under-fire-after-sending-325k-to-privacy-protocol/) has explained why as much as 90% of his personal crypto funds are secured through a multi-signature hardware wallet solution. Buterin revealed this information while commenting on a trend urging crypto users to migrate to hardware wallet solutions.
Crypto data analyst Kofi [sparked](https://x.com/0xKofi/status/1785294613579730966) the conversion by painting a scenario where crypto users woke up one day and discovered their investments had been stolen. Notably, stories of devastating losses are rampant in the crypto scene, particularly as the bull market gains momentum.¬†
As crypto enthusiasts participate in airdrop activities and other endeavors, they become susceptible to [bad actors who create similar but fraudulent activities](https://coinedition.com/investigation-shows-655000-solana-valued-122-5m-sent-to-scam-presales/) intended to steal their seed phrase to ultimately drain their wallets.
Renowned crypto investigator ZachXBT recently [uncovered](https://x.com/zachxbt/status/1784935501935390930) that the Lazarus Group orchestrated over 25 crypto hacks to launder $200 million. On the other hand, security firm CertiK [disclosed](https://x.com/CertiKAlert/status/1785262226430926997) that the crypto community witnessed exploits worth $21 million in April, often involving hacks and wallet drainers.
While utilizing a hardware wallet solution could prevent some of these exploits, the founder of the NFT trading platform Reservoir contends that the primary risk shifts to the users themselves. The risks include forgetting or losing the seed phrase, especially if it is hidden too well or stored in a bank safety deposit box and becomes inaccessible due to sudden relocation.
In response, Vitalik Buterin noted that the cited concerns are precisely why he opted for a multisig service like Safe for over 90% of his personal funds.¬†
> The above is why I use a multisig ([@safe](https://twitter.com/safe?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)) for >90% of my personal funds üôÇ > > M-of-N, some keys held by you (but not enough to block recovery), the rest held by other people you trust. Don't reveal who those other people are, even to each other. > > Decentralize your own security. > > ‚Äî vitalik.eth (@VitalikButerin) [May 1, 2024](https://twitter.com/VitalikButerin/status/1785562273433387320?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
He explained that multi-sig setups, where multiple keys are required for transactions but not all held by the user, provide an added layer of security.¬† Typically, some keys are held by the user, but not enough to independently recover the funds. The remaining keys are entrusted to other individuals whom one trusts.
‚ÄúDon‚Äôt reveal who those other people are, even to each other. Decentralize your own security.‚Äù Buterin concluded.

Title: Interpol Finalizes Extradition Paperwork for Binance Executive | Cryptopolitan
URL Source: https://www.cryptopolitan.com/interpol-extradition-paperwork-binance-executive/
Markdown Content: The Nigerian Central Bureau of Interpol has finalized the extradition papers of Nadeem Anjarwalla, a [Binance](https://www.cryptopolitan.com/news/binance-bnb/) Holdings official currently having legal problems. Anjarwalla left Nigeria after [being accused o](https://www.cryptopolitan.com/nigeria-holds-binance-execs-eyes-march-20-hearing/)f money laundering and tax evasion and is now believed to be in Kenya. Garba Umar, head of the Nigerian NCB, also pointed out that attempts are already being made to serve a Red Notice to bring Anjarwalla back to Nigeria for trial.
In an appearance on the local ‚ÄúSunrise Daily‚Äù on April 30, Umar divulged that Anjarwalla‚Äôs precise location is not known, but his last known location was Kenya. Interpol is coordinating with various countries Anjarwalla may have traveled through to gather essential information, which remains confidential.
Incident Details and Binance Exiting Nigeria --------------------------------------------
Despite Nigerian officials confiscating Anjarwalla‚Äôs travel documents, he left Nigeria on March 22, raising questions about the control of his departure. At the same time, Tigran Gambaryan, Anjarwalla‚Äôs colleague, [was arrested](https://www.cryptopolitan.com/nigerian-court-delays-binance-executive-bail/) on similar charges. He pleaded not guilty and is detained for his bail hearing scheduled for May 17. Gambaryan‚Äôs case led to a petition for his release, which has gained over 4,000 signatures.
Subsequent to this, Binance declared its withdrawal from the Nigerian market after the governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria accused Binance of involvement in illegal transactions. In consequence, Binance stopped all transactions in the Nigerian naira and delisted all naira trading pairs from its peer-to-peer trading platform in late February. This move signals a major withdrawal from one of Africa‚Äôs biggest cryptocurrency markets.
Litigations and Regulatory Measures -----------------------------------
The charges against Anjarwalla have triggered a united international effort to arrest and repatriate him to Nigeria. The ongoing case is an indication of Interpol‚Äôs growing role in solving transnational financial crimes. This event is a component of overall enforcement measures aimed at compliance and regulatory adherence in the sphere of cryptocurrency.

Markdown Content: Blockchain development firm Movement Labs has received an undisclosed investment from Binance Labs, the venture capital arm of Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange. This investment comes on the heels of Movement Labs' $38 million Series A funding round led by Polychain Capital.
Movement Labs is on a mission to build an ecosystem of blockchains based on the modular programming language Move, starting with ‚ÄúM2‚Äù, a Move Virtual Machine Layer 2 for Ethereum. The company plans to use the funds to expand into the Asia-Pacific region and encourage adoption of the Move programming language across broader blockchain ecosystems.
‚ÄúBinance Labs' support and expertise will be invaluable as we continue to implement our 'Move Anywhere' strategy, focusing on the vibrant and innovative APAC market,‚Äù said Rushi Manche, co-founder of Movement Labs.
Movement's Layer 2 blockchain aims to expand the use of the Move programming language beyond the well-known Aptos and Sui Layer 1 blockchains. Move was originally developed by a team within Meta, formerly known as Facebook's now-defunct Diem stablecoin project.
Additionally, Movement Labs is developing Move Stack, an execution layer framework compatible with rollups such as Optimism, Polygon, and Arbitrum. The company will launch its public testnet Parthenon in the coming weeks and aims for a mainnet launch by the end of the year.
