Title: Crypto losses caused by exploits fall 141% in April: CertiK
URL Source: https://cryptobriefing.com/april-exploit-reduction-crypto/
Published Time: 2024-05-01T17:11:55+00:00
Markdown Content: Fewer key compromises and exit scams are pointed as the reasons behind the record fall. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Crypto protocols witnessed $25.7 million in losses across three major incidents in April, reaching a record low since 2021. Blockchain security firm CertiK highlights that this is a 141% decrease from March‚Äôs figures.
The reduction in losses is due to the fall in private key compromise incidents, which plummeted from eleven in March to just three in April, CertiK underscored.
[![Image 1: Sapphire](https://static.cryptobriefing.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/18060845/600x500.jpg)](https://sapphire.cryptobriefing.com/?utm_source=cryptobriefing&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=180324&ap=mreciad&offer=x240415070T0U7V)
The largest exploit in April involved FixedFloat, with suspicious withdrawals totaling approximately $3 million across multiple chains. FixedFloat acknowledged this as their second exploit by the same attackers since February.
Meanwhile, exit scams also saw a downturn, with the most notable being CondomSol‚Äôs pre-sale scam on the Solana network, leading to losses of around $933,000. In total, April experienced 13 exit scams, a 40% reduction from the previous month.
![Image 2: Crypto losses caused by exploits fall 141% in April: CertiK](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20571%20887'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
Flash loan attacks in April resulted in the lowest monthly losses since February 2022, with four incidents totaling $129,086. The largest of these accounted for $55,000. Combining all incidents, April‚Äôs losses amounted to approximately $25.7 million, the lowest on record since 2021.
However, the brief CertiK report on April losses does not account for the ZKasino controversy. ZKasino‚Äôs co-founders allegedly performed an exit scam on April 25, by swapping nearly $33 million worth of Ether (ETH) for their native token ZKAS. The funds were locked on the gambling platform bridge, as users tried to be eligible for ZKAS airdrop.
CertiK published that a more in-depth analysis will be provided as more information about this episode emerges.

Title: 'Bitcoin Senator' Cynthia Lummis Blasts DOJ Stance on Private Crypto Wallets
URL Source: https://decrypt.co/229020/bitcoin-senator-cynthia-lummis-blasts-doj-stance-crypto-wallets
Published Time: 2024-05-01T17:09:15
Markdown Content: United States Senator Cynthia Lummis (R-WY) has stated that she is "deeply troubled" by the Department of Justice's (DOJ's) stance on non-custodial software.
In a [tweet](https://twitter.com/SenLummis/status/1785695683514630367), Lummis expressed concern at the DOJ's "hyper-aggressive argument that non-custodial software can constitute a money transmission service." She added that the DOJ's stance "contradicts existing Treasury guidance," and "violates the rule of law."
"Arguments against self-custody software threaten the fundamental property rights that are core to being an American," Lummis said, adding that she will fight "for your rights to hold your own keys and run your own node." She further accused the Biden Administration of "criminalizing core tenants of the [Bitcoin](https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-bitcoin-four-minute-instant-guide-explainer) network and [decentralized finance](https://decrypt.co/resources/defi-ultimate-beginners-guide-decentralized-finance)."
Lummis' comments follow two recent cases where DOJ prosecutors have pushed for criminal charges against software developers for unlicensed money transmission: an unsealed indictment against Bitcoin mixer [Samourai Wallet](https://decrypt.co/227949/feds-arrest-founders-bitcoin-mixer-samourai-wallet), and a [reply brief](https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.nysd.604938/gov.uscourts.nysd.604938.53.0.pdf) responding to the defense's motion to dismiss in the [case](https://decrypt.co/news-explorer?pinned=277556&title=tornado-cash-co-founder-roman-storm-arrested-for-money-laundering) against Tornado Cash developer Roman Storm.
> I am deeply concerned by the Biden administration criminalizing¬†core tenants of the Bitcoin network and decentralized finance. > > My full statement. ‚¨áÔ∏è [pic.twitter.com/M3CHcNTi3x](https://t.co/M3CHcNTi3x) > > ‚Äî Senator Cynthia Lummis (@SenLummis) [May 1, 2024](https://twitter.com/SenLummis/status/1785695683514630367?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
The DOJ's interpretation of money transmission laws, encompassing wallet developers who have no direct control over user assets, has sparked a backlash among the crypto community.
Crypto advocacy group [Coin Center](https://www.coincenter.org/dojs-new-stance-on-crypto-wallets-is-a-threat-to-liberty-and-the-rule-of-law/) has characterized the DOJ's stance as "a massive overreach," arguing that it contradicts [existing FinCEN guidance](https://www.fincen.gov/sites/default/files/shared/FIN-2013-G001.pdf) and [rulings](https://www.fincen.gov/resources/statutes-regulations/administrative-rulings/application-fincens-regulations-virtual).
In a blog post, Coin Center's director of research Peter Van Valkenburgh claimed the DOJ's position would mean that "every functioning cryptocurrency wallet and smart contract is 'doing' money transmission and every developer is engaged in unlicensed money transmission."
The group has filed an [amicus brief](https://www.coincenter.org/coin-center-files-a-court-brief-in-defense-of-tornado-cash-developer/) in defense of Roman Storm, arguing that the publication of Tornado Cash's code is constitutionally protected under the First Amendment.

_Geoffrey Kendrick_, head of Forex and Digital Assets Research at [Standard Chartered,](https://finbold.com/guide/buy-bitcoin-with-standard-chartered/) has voiced concerns after Bitcoin‚Äôs recent dip below $60,000, indicating a potential drop toward $50,000-$52,000, according to [reports](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2024/05/01/bitcoin-could-drop-further-to-as-low-as-50k-standard-chartered-says/).
Adding to the [crypto](https://finbold.com/cryptocurrencies/) market‚Äôs challenges are the significant outflows from U.S. spot Bitcoin [ETF](https://finbold.com/etfs/)s and tepid interest in Hong Kong‚Äôs newly launched [spot Bitcoin ETFs](https://finbold.com/guide/what-is-bitcoin-etf/), the factors Kendrick cites as primary reasons for the recent downturn.
### Picks for you
Key factors include five consecutive days of outflows from U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs and prices falling below the ETFs‚Äô average purchase price. Furthermore, the average purchase price of these ETFs falling below $58,000 increases the risk of liquidation, especially since more than half of these ETF positions are incurring losses.
Additionally, the bank pointed out that the launch of the Hong Kong spot ETF did not meet expectations, with the focus on the low turnover volume of $11 million overshadowing the satisfactory net asset position of the new ETFs.
The broader economic environment hasn‚Äôt been supportive either, with tightening liquidity measures in the U.S. which have been worsening since mid-April, exerting additional pressure on risk assets like Bitcoin.
Long-term optimism despite current volatility ---------------------------------------------
Despite these immediate challenges, Standard Chartered remains [bullish](https://finbold.com/guide/bull-market-definition/) on Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term prospects. The bank recently revised its [end-of-2024](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/04/25/standard-chartered-bitcoin-btc-to-hit-150000-after-halving.html) Bitcoin price prediction upward from $100,000 to $150,000.
The bank recommends purchasing Bitcoin if it falls to the $50,000-$52,000 range, or if the U.S. Consumer Price Index (CPI) on the 15th, which measures inflation, is favorable.
While the market currently faces downward pressure, the underlying momentum and institutional interest suggest that Bitcoin might rebound strongly. This belief is anchored in the crypto‚Äôs past performance and its foundational role in the digital asset space, pointing towards recovery as market conditions improve and as strategic investments in the ecosystem continue to unfold.
